title: Shelter 3 & Meadow
summary: I worked at Might And Delight studio as a junior animator at Shelter 3 and Meadow projects and made keyframe animations for elephants and elephant babies, crocodiles, buffaloes for Shelter 3 and more animations for elephant babies for Meadows . All animation made in Motion Builder.

drafts.title: The hungry baby calf animation for Shelter 3

title: Moonzy (Лунтик и его друзья)
summary: I began my work at Studio Melnitsa in St. Petersburg on the Moonzy project, a TV series for pre-school children, from pre-production in 2005 and until 2008. This was my first experience working in a large studio and getting acquainted with the animation production pipeline. The first seasons were produced using 2D cutout techniques in After Effects, with character design and backgrounds created in Photoshop. My responsibilities included 2D cut-out animation, character design, and pre-production tasks.

title: The Barkers (Барбоскины)
description:
My responsibilities included:

  • Preparation of layouts
  • Draft rendering of animations for rough cut editing
  • Episodes cleanup together with episode director, artistic director, lead animator
  • Simple and complex lighting, working alongside with lighting supervisor
  • Collaboration with Dynamic and Texture & Background departments
  • Final rendering
  • Compositing, 2D effects

Tools used: Autodesk Maya, Pixar Renderman, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop, basic Nuke

title: Huba-bubba commercials
summary: After studying at St. Petersburg State University of Film and Television I started working as a Character Assistant on 'Hubba-bubba' commercials by Visotsky&Sikorsky Animation Studio in 2004 - 2005 (internship, later employment).
description:
After studying at St. Petersburg State University of Film and Television I started working as a Character Assistant on 'Hubba-bubba' commercials by Visotsky&Sikorsky Animation Studio in 2004 - 2005 (internship, later employment).

It was good old clay animation! My duty was to again and again sculpt plasticine characters for stop-motion animation.
